Terungkap! Ini Alasan Garuda 'Cerai' dengan Sriwijaya
07 Nov 2019, 08:39 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: detikFoto

Jakarta - Manajemen PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk buka suara mengenai kabar perceraian dengan PT Sriwijaya Air. Kabar perceraian terkuak lantaran pesan Direktur Pemeliharaan & Layanan Garuda Indonesia, Iwan Joeniarto mengenai hubungan bisnis dengan Sriwijaya tersebar ke awak media.VP Corporate Secretary Garuda Indonesia M Ikhsan Rosan menjelaskan, pesan atau surat itu sebenarnya ditujukan ke perusahaan pembiayaan (lessor) atau pemilik yang menyewakan pesawat yang mempertanyakan hubungan dengan Sriwijaya."Sebenarnya itu memang informasi kepada lessor. Jadi lessor nanya ke kita, bagaimana kerja sama kita dengan Sriwijaya. Penjelasan itu kita sampaikan bahwa ya kaitan hubungan sama lessor itu menjadi tanggung jawab sendiri oleh Sriwijaya," katanya kepada detikcom, Kamis (7/11/2019).Lalu, Ikhsan mengungkapkan, kerja sama Garuda dengan Sriwijaya sebenarnya untuk mengamankan piutang Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) yang tak lain perpanjangan tangan negara. Tanpa menyebut besarannya, Ikhsan mengatakan, saat ini pihaknya tengah melakukan negosiasi supaya Sriwijaya membayar utangnya."Ya poinnya gini kita masuk kerja sama Sriwijaya mengamankan piutang negara lah ya, berhutang ke negara. Pertamina, BNI, Gapura, GMF kita mengamankan itu. Sekarang kita sedang negosiasi, harapan kita mereka itikad menyelesaikan itu, utang-utang itu institusi negara itu," jelasnya.Bagaimana nasib kerjasamanya? Ikhsan menuturkan hingga saat ini belum ada putusan final apakah kerja sama berhenti atau lanjut kembali."Jadi sebenarnya belum bisa bilang finalnya sih, ya kita harapkan itikad baik atas itu, utang-utang kepada negara tadi," ungkapnya.Sebagai informasi, pesan yang ditujukan ke lessor itu mengungkap kerja sama manajemen antara Sriwijaya Air dan PT Citilink Indonesia yakni anak usaha Garuda Indonesia. Dijelaskan, karena keadaan dan beberapa hal yang belum diselesaikan oleh kedua pihak maka Sriwijaya Air melanjutkan bisnis sendiri."Dengan demikian, Sriwijaya tidak akan lagi menjadi anggota Garuda Indonesia Group," kata Iwan Joeni.Simak Video "Ratusan Penumpang Sriwijaya Air Telantar di Bandara Hasanuddin"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)

Revealed! This is the reason Garuda is 'divorced' from Sriwijaya
Nov 7 2019, 08:39 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: detikPhoto

Jakarta - The management of PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk opened its voice regarding news of divorce with PT Sriwijaya Air. The news of the divorce was revealed because the message of Garuda Indonesia Maintenance & Service Director Iwan Joeniarto about business relations with Sriwijaya spread to the media. Garuda Indonesia's Corporate Secretary M Ikhsan Rosan explained, the message or letter was actually addressed to the finance company (lessor) or the owner who was renting out the plane questioned the relationship with Sriwijaya. "Actually, it was indeed information to the lessor. So the lessor asked us how we are working with Sriwijaya. We explained that we explained that the relationship with the lessor was the responsibility of Sriwijaya himself," he told AFP. , Thursday (11/07/2019). Then, Ikhsan revealed, Garuda's cooperation with Sriwijaya was actually to secure the receivables of State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs) which were nothing but an extension of the state. Without mentioning the amount, Ikhsan said, currently his party was in negotiations so that Srivijaya would pay its debts. "Yes, the point is that we enter into cooperation with Sriwijaya to secure the state's receivables, owe it to the state. Pertamina, BNI, Gapura, GMF, we secure it. Now we are securing it. "We are negotiating, our hope is that they will resolve it, the debts are the state institutions," he explained. What is the fate of the partnership? Ikhsan said that until now there had been no final decision on whether the cooperation would stop or continue. "So actually we cannot say the final, yes, we expect good faith over that, the debts to the country," he said. the lessor revealed the management collaboration between Sriwijaya Air and PT Citilink Indonesia, a subsidiary of Garuda Indonesia. Explained, because of the situation and several things that had not been resolved by both parties, Sriwijaya Air continued its own business. "Thus, Sriwijaya will no longer be a member of the Garuda Indonesia Group," said Iwan Joeni.
